definitions.definition: To cause (a substance) to fall in fine drops (for a liquid substance) or small pieces (for a solid substance).
examples: The confectioner sprinkled icing sugar over the cakes.

definitions.definition: To cover (an object) by sprinkling a substance on to it.
examples: The confectioner sprinkled the cakes with icing sugar.

definitions.definition: To drip in fine drops, sometimes sporadically.
examples: It sprinkled outside all day long.
It sprinkled very early in the morning.

definitions.definition: To baptize by the application of a few drops, or a small quantity, of water; hence, to cleanse ; to purify .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause (a substance) to fall in fine drops (for a liquid substance) or small pieces (for a solid substance).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cover (an object) by sprinkling a substance on to it.
( intransitive ) To drip in fine drops, sometimes sporadically.
( intransitive ) To rain very lightly outside.
( transitive ) To baptize by the application of a few drops, or a small quantity, of water; hence, to cleanse ; to purify .
This term needs a definition. Please help out and add a definition , then remove the text  .
